replyContent: Yes, there are optional Premium Features. There is no "search function" as a Premium Feature. Searching is part of the app functionality. A "Placeholder" database has ALL shaft TYPES. A database with most shaft MFGs is a Premium Feature. SPINE,FOC,MO,KE,TAW,and FPS are all calculated with NO ADDITIONAL purchases required.

None had issues with freezing, minimize/maximize, or sleep/restart WHEN THE APP WAS RELEASED. THIS IS AN ANDROID OS ISSUE.

content: The app freezes whenever the screensaver on my Android 4.4.2 Samsung tablet activates, meaning all the inputs that I have made are lost, and I need to restart the device to get the app functioning again. Otherwise the functionality seems good. Works well for compound bow calculations, and the data output seems sensible, but haven't yet confirmed this with bareshaft tuning. I was a little disappointed to find that it doesn't support recurve calcs, but for the price, this is understandable and ok.
replyContent: It is neither "compound" nor "recurve" specific..It supports all bows. Calculations are based on the IBO of the bow regardless of type. For a recurve, all you need to do is determine its IBO. E-mail for a simple "how-to".  Will try to duplicate the app freeze.

content: Updated review after my question was promptly answered via email. App acts as a quick tool to properly set up arrows, once a few additional premium features are purchased.
replyContent: As stated in the store description, there are in-app premium features that may be purchased.  The "placeholder" database is provided to show app functionality.   A complete arrow database of 42+ current and discontinued manufacturers is one of the premium features and is available for $1.

content: Needs some improvements. Paid for 5 saves, but lost 3 trying to figure out how to make it work and save user configurations. Can't even delete blanks to reuse the configuration. It's a needed idea and useful for spine checking, and overall maybe a little cheaper than the full blown software, but needs tweaks. update..saves were credited by developer, and all works great. thanks.
replyContent: There is a known issue with some Android OSes when switching between apps..it should be resolved in the next version.  Most OSes work as you'd expect.  Looking into a Rename function for User Records.  If you contact me via e-mail, I can make an adjustment to your user record count.

content: i was skeptical about this app even before i download it and i can honestly say it was a complete waste of time and money. complete garbage constantly changes the configurations every time you leave the page and try to configure something else. not one single time did it recommend a single spine correctly. do yourself a favor and dont waste your time like i did mine
replyContent: Most shafts come with components that do not weigh the same.  A configuration changes ONLY when you select a different shaft to model..reflecting the change in its components.  This is by design.   If you need to restore a user configuration after you do a bunch of "what-if" changes, then you simply load a saved user record.

As far as customer support goes, I have had a very good experience with the developer (i.e. fast feedback and assistance in using the app).  I would give 4.5/5 if I could, not a full 5 as my personal preference is that the quick selection is a bit clunky.  Overall though, good app.

content: What does your dollar get you? Nearly nothing. Imagine EA but worse. Your original purchase only grants you basic calculations which can be done by yourself on paper. It costs an extra dollar to have a database of arrows/bows. It cost another dollar to save your own setup so that you don't have to keep retyping. Want more than one? Pay another 2 dollars! Do you want to be able to use a search? Extra dollar! Do you want to be able to quickly change? Extra dollar! These flaws in addition to having an app design from 2008 makes it a great tool to see if the refund button on Google play works.
replyContent: There are those that actually appreciate NOT having to hunt down and integrate formulas and data. To recap, $1 to accurately calculate SPINE,FOC,MO,KE,TAW,and FPS..WITHOUT ADS. Another optional $1 to search current and discontinued Mfg shaft data..which can be done by visiting 20 or so websites.  PRICELESS.  What's your time worth?

content: I like the app but there isn't any real way to know how to interpret it. And what do the PB, GB, PI etc mean next to certain spine options?
replyContent: Some shaft Mfgs offer different nock systems.  The "-XX" following a shaft model indicates the system.  -PB=PinNockBushing -GB=GNockBushing -FB=FNockBushing -BC=BulldogCollar  There are other "-XX" extensions, but the idea was that component weight follow the shaft so it wasn't required that you look it up.  -PI = -PB.  Next DB will only have -PB

content: BUYER BEWARE!!!  Problems on the first use.. NO CUSTOMER SUPPORT! Saved several files with various bow and arrow configurations and when trying to open a saved file the app reads 23 records available but only shows 7 or less.. The app license is only good for one device unlike most other play store apps are for multiple devices.. Contacted the software developer on multiple apps license and saved file issues with  no support in resolving the problem stating he has no problems after testing it on his android devices..  After paying for a license for my Android phone and one for my Android Galaxy Tablet they both have the same exact problem I ask for a refund and the reply back was simply "Sorry no refunds" Really?
replyContent: When you say "The app license is only good for one device", you are incorrect.  If you load the app from the Google Play Store on a device linked to your account, Google does not make you buy the app again.    Subscriptions, which have been discontinued, where the only purchases tied to a specific device.

content: Terrible. Buggy. Keeps resetting my bow parameters.  No option for recurve archery.  Worst interface.
replyContent:
It does not reset your bow parameters. It loads a default at startup.  Load a saved user record to restore your settings.

It is neither "compound" nor "recurve" specific..It supports all bows. Calculations are based on the IBO of the bow regardless of type.   For a recurve, all you need to do is determine its IBO.

E-mail for a simple "how-to".

content: Finally a mobile app! I hate that it changes arrow configurations if you select different shafts. You have to save your record before you start your search otherwise you'll have to reenter all your numbers, pretty annoying.
replyContent:
The configuration changes you mention are due to the shaft component weights changing when a new shaft is selected.  Most components differ in weight so it would be normal to see differences.

Maybe a "lock" check box option to prevent the changes from the database?

E-mail if you have other suggestions or ideas on how to resolve.

content: Fmj 5mm is not on it and I uninstalled it and re-downloaded it and it wanted me to pay again...no way
replyContent:
Easton  4mm, 5mm, and 6mm FMJ are in the current database.   The next release will have an auto-DB-refresh to update the database when a new one is available.   

Re-downloading the app should not erase the in-app purchase record from local app storage..only uninstalling would do that.  Store rules prohibit issuing "free" in-app codes. Sorry.
